suppress.notes: SnakeYaml's Constructor() class does not restrict types which can be instantiated during deserialization.
Jackson core needs major version latest 2.12.7 not resolving current CVE issue. Same applies to json-path version 2.4.0. Same applies to json-smart version 2.4.10
jackson-databind before 2.13.0 allows a Java StackOverflow exception and denial of service via a large depth of nested objects.
Handlebars core needs major version latest 4.2.1 not resolving current CVE issue.
liquibase-core core needs major version latest 4.2.2. not resolving current CVE issue.
spring-security-config, crypto and web needs major version latest 5.4.11. not resolving current CVE issue.
logback-classic and core needs major version latest 1.2.11. not resolving current CVE issue.
Upgrading tomcat causes unhealthy pipeline error.

In spring framework versions prior to 5.2.24 release+ ,5.3.27+ and 6.0.8+ , it is possible for a user to provide a specially crafted SpEL expression that may cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

The PGJDBC implementation of the `java.sql.ResultRow.refreshRow()` method is not performing escaping of column names so a malicious column name that contains a statement terminator, e.g. `;`, could lead to SQL injection. Note this is fixed in the version of postgresql 42.6.0 but still showing up as an error, so suppressing.

jackson-databind 2.10.x through 2.12.x before 2.12.6 and 2.13.x before 2.13.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (2 GB transient heap usage per read) in uncommon situations involving JsonNode JDK serialization.
Spring context requires major update. Currently version 2.3.11 reuires major update to atleast 2.5
CVE-2023-35116 An issue was discovered jackson-databind thru 2.15.2 allows attackers to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impacts via crafted object that uses cyclic dependencies.
CVE-2023-2976 Use of Java's default temporary directory for file creation in `FileBackedOutputStream` in Google Guava versions 1.0 to 31.1 on Unix systems
CVE-2023-35116 SnakeYaml's Constructor() class does not restrict types which can be instantiated during deserialization.
